parameters.content:
### üü¢ Node: `On form submission` (Form Trigger)

**üìå What it does:**  
This is the starting point of the workflow. It shows a form titled:  
**‚ÄúInterested in our Product/Service?‚Äù**  
It asks for First Name, Last Name, and Email.

Once someone fills it in, the workflow begins.

**üõ† You can customize:**
- Form title and description
- Add more fields (like phone number, budget, etc.)
- Make fields optional or required
- Change button color, fonts, etc. using `customCss`

**üí° Tip:** Keep your form short and easy ‚Äî the fewer steps, the more leads you'll get.

### üü° Node: `email_variables` (Set Node)

**üìå What it does:**  
This node holds all the reusable content for your welcome email ‚Äî like the subject line, greeting, booking link, and sender details.

**üõ† You can customize:**
- Your welcome message (`welcome_message`)
- Call-to-action wording and booking link (`cta_intro`, `cta_link`)
- Your name, role, company, and email
- Footer or disclaimer text

**üí° Tip:** Update these in one place to apply changes across the workflow instantly.

### üü† Node: `client_info` (Set Node)

**üìå What it does:**  
This node maps the submitted form data (first name, last name, email) into variables for later use in the email and spreadsheet.

**üõ† You can customize:**
- Add more fields (like company, phone number)
- Use conditions later (e.g., only email people with a business email)

**üí° Tip:** This keeps your workflow organized and flexible.

Need help customizing it?  
üìÖ Book a free 15-min call: [Book Call](https://calendly.com/rmp71171/new-meeting)

## üß† Why I Made This

I specifically chose **free and familiar tools like Google Sheets + Gmail** ‚Äî and avoided AI APIs or paid CRMs ‚Äî to help you:

- üß© Keep costs **at zero**  
- üèÉ Get started **immediately**  
- üéØ Focus on what actually matters: talking to leads and growing your business

This is perfect if you're not ready to invest in tools like HubSpot, Pipedrive, or paid AI integrations yet ‚Äî but still want a professional, automated workflow.

# üì• Lead Capture System ‚Äî Free n8n Automation by Rhmopo

This free automation helps you **capture leads through a form**, save their info to Google Sheets, and **automatically send them a personalized email with a booking link** ‚Äî no coding required.

Perfect for:  
üì¢ Coaches ¬∑ üî• Course Creators ¬∑ ü§ñ SaaS Founders ¬∑ üß∞ Service Providers

### üü£ Node: `Gmail`

**üìå What it does:**  
Sends a personalized welcome email immediately after the form is submitted. It uses the data and template set in earlier nodes.

**üõ† You can customize:**
- Email subject and content (uses HTML for formatting)
- Swap Gmail for Outlook, SendGrid, or any other email service
- Add tracking links, a PDF, or embed a calendar widget

**üí° Tip:** Fast follow-up = higher conversion. Personalize this message as much as possible.

### üîµ Node: `Google Sheets`

**üìå What it does:**  
Saves every new lead into your Google Sheet so you can:
- View all leads in one place
- Filter, sort, or export them later
- Use it as a basic free CRM

**üõ† You can customize:**
- The spreadsheet or tab name
- Add more columns for extra fields
- Use matching columns to avoid duplicates

**üí° Tip:** This is where your lead list lives ‚Äî keep it backed up!

**You will need to setup with your own credentials.**

## ‚úÖ Next Steps for You

- üß™ Test the form with your own email
- ‚úèÔ∏è Tweak the form and email to match your offer
- üîó Share your form on your website, landing page, or link in bio
- üìà Use the Google Sheet to track responses over time

### üü§ Node: `Create Blank Sheet` (Google Sheets)

**üìå What it does:**  
This node is used **one time only** to automatically create a new Google Sheet ‚Äî the one your automation will write leads to.

You trigger it manually by clicking **‚ÄúExecute Node‚Äù** in n8n.

---

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes:**

- This is **not part of the live automation** ‚Äî it‚Äôs only for setup.
- After the sheet is created, go into Google Sheets and manually add these columns in the first row:
  - `First Name`
  - `Last Name`
  - `Email`
- These column names must match the form field labels ‚Äî spelled exactly like that.

---

**üìõ Sheet Name Tip:**  
You can name the spreadsheet **whatever you like**, but that name **must exactly match** what you use in the **main Google Sheets node** later in the workflow.

> Example: If you name the sheet `My CRM Leads`, make sure the Google Sheets node also uses `My CRM Leads` as the document name.

---

**üìù Or do this manually instead:**  
1. Go to [Google Sheets](https://sheets.google.com)  
2. Create a new sheet and name it  
3. In the first row, add columns: `First Name`, `Last Name`, `Email`  
4. Update your Google Sheets node in n8n to match your sheet‚Äôs name and tab

---

**‚úÖ You can customize:**
- Sheet name (just be consistent!)
- Tab/sheet name (`Sheet1` is default ‚Äî change it only if you also update the node)

**üí° Tip:** Once setup is complete, you can delete or disable this node ‚Äî it‚Äôs not required after your sheet is ready.

## ‚úÖ STEP 1: Create Your Lead Sheet

This step sets up the Google Sheet where your leads will be saved.

---

### üîß Instructions:

1. **Double-click** the `Create Blank Sheet` node.
2. Click on **"Credentials to connect with"** and create new credentials if you haven‚Äôt already.
3. Click **"Sign in with Google"** and follow the prompts to authorize n8n.
4. Click the **"Title"** textbox and enter the name of your spreadsheet (e.g. `Lead List`).
5. Click **"Test Setup"** to make sure the connection works.
6. Go to [Google Sheets](https://sheets.google.com) ‚Äî you‚Äôll see the new spreadsheet with the title you just entered.

---

### üìÑ Now set up the sheet:

1. In the **first row**, add these three column headers:
   - `First Name`
   - `Last Name`
   - `Email`

2. Highlight that first row.

3. In the toolbar, click **View ‚Üí Freeze ‚Üí 1 row** to lock the headers in place.

---

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:**  
The spreadsheet name you choose **must exactly match** the one used later in the `Google Sheets` node of your workflow.

## ‚úÖ STEP 4: Connect and Test the Lead Capture Sheet

Now it‚Äôs time to connect the form to your sheet and map the submitted data.

---

### üîß Instructions:

1. **Double-click** the second Google Sheets node titled **`Input Customer Info`**.
2. In the **Document** textbox, select the name of the spreadsheet you created earlier (e.g. `Lead List`).
3. In the **Sheet** textbox, select `Sheet1` (or whatever tab name you used in Google Sheets).
4. Under **Column Mapping Mode**, choose **"Map each column manually"** for full control.
5. In the **Column to match on** field, select `"First Name"`.

---

### üß™ Populate Test Data:

To map the fields, you need sample data:

1. Click **"Test Workflow"** at the bottom of the n8n screen (outside the node).
2. A submission form will appear ‚Äî enter:
   - A first name
   - A last name
   - A valid email address
3. The workflow will **fail on purpose** ‚Äî this is okay!  
   The goal is just to create test data for mapping.

---

### üß© Map Your Fields:

1. Go back to the **`Input Customer Info`** node and open it again.
2. On the left (under **Input**), you‚Äôll see the sample payload.
3. Under `client_info`, you‚Äôll find:
   - `First Name`
   - `Last Name`
   - `Email`
4. **Drag and drop** each of those fields into their corresponding boxes under **Values to Send**.
5. Click **"Test Step"** to push this data to your Google Sheet.

---

### ‚úÖ Verify Your Setup:

1. Head back to your spreadsheet.
2. You should now see a new row with the submitted data!

---

### üåê Go Live:

You're ready to share your form!

1. Click the **`On form submission`** node (at the top of the workflow).
2. Click **"Production URL"** to copy your live form link.
3. Paste this link wherever you want to collect leads:
   - Social media bios
   - Linktree
   - Landing pages
   - QR codes, and more

---

**üéâ You‚Äôre all set!**  
Your Lead Capture System is now live and ready to bring in leads while you focus on what matters most.

## ‚úÖ STEP 3: Connect to Your Google Account

This step connects your n8n workflow to your Google account so it can access your Google Sheet.

---

### üîß Instructions:

1. Click on **"Credentials to connect with"** inside the Google Sheets node.
2. If you haven‚Äôt already, click **"Create New"** to add credentials.
3. Click **"Sign in with Google"** and follow the prompts to authorize access.
4. Once connected, select your account from the dropdown to confirm the integration.

---

**üí° Tip:**  
You only need to do this once ‚Äî n8n will remember your credentials for future workflows.

# Blue Sticky Notes:
## STEPS TO SETUP THE WORKFLOW

## ‚úÖ STEP 2: Customize Your Email Content

Now it‚Äôs time to personalize the email that your leads will receive after submitting the form.

---

### üîß Instructions:

1. **Double-click** the `email_variables` node in your workflow.
2. You‚Äôll see a list of pre-filled fields like:
   - `welcome_message`
   - `invitation_message`
   - `cta_intro`
   - `cta_link`
   - `sender_name`, `position`, and more
3. **Update these fields to match your voice, offer, and branding.**  
   For example:
   - Change the message to reflect *why* you‚Äôre reaching out
   - Add your **Calendly** or booking link to `cta_link`
   - Update the sender‚Äôs name, position, and company info

---

### üß† What This Does:
These values will be used to generate the personalized welcome email ‚Äî so you don‚Äôt need to hard-code anything later.

---

**üí° Tip:** You can come back and update these values anytime without changing the HTML email or logic of the automation.
